questions.text: What integrity verification is required for all release artifacts?

options.explanation: Visual inspection is not applicable to software artifacts.
Per Section 5.1, all release artifacts must include SHA-256 integrity hashes.
Peer review verifies code quality, not artifact integrity.

options.text: No verification required for digital products
options.explanation: Digital products require integrity verification just like physical products.

questions.text: Who must approve product labeling content before use?

options.explanation: Engineering develops content but Regulatory provides approval.
Per Section 5.3, Regulatory approves label content before use.
Marketing is not involved in regulatory labeling approval.
Label approval is a Regulatory responsibility.

questions.text: IFU updates are only needed when the software version changes.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.5, the IFU is updated with each release that affects user-facing behavior, not every version change. Conversely, IFU may need updating due to regulatory changes even without a software change.

questions.text: How must translated labels be verified?

options.explanation: Machine translation alone does not meet the verification requirement.

options.text: Back-translation or review by native-speaking subject matter expert
options.explanation: Per Section 5.6, translations must be verified through back-translation or review by a native-speaking subject matter expert.
A qualified translator and expert reviewer are required, not any bilingual person.

options.text: No verification needed for digital labels
options.explanation: All translated labels require verification regardless of format.

questions.text: How often are archived release artifacts verified for integrity?

options.explanation: Monthly exceeds the required verification frequency.
Per Section 5.1, archives are verified annually for integrity and accessibility.
Five years is too infrequent for archive integrity verification.
Verification is scheduled annually, not only on access.
